p: Sulphur-containing compounds are among the most important aroma volatiles in many processed foods (Landaud et al. 2008; McGorrin 2011). Both aliphatic and heterocyclic sulphur volatiles are present in food at low concentrations, but their low odour thresholds make them potent aroma compounds conferring sulphurous, onion-like and meaty aromas to foods.
